csharp.using: System, System.Collections.Generic, System.Text, System.Diagnostics, System.Xml.Serialization, DISnet.DataStreamUtilities

class.name: UnsignedIntegerWrapper
class.comment: Wrapper for an unsigned 32 bit integer

attribute.name: wrapper
attribute.comment: name can't be too accurate or the generated source code will have reserved word problems

class.name: AcousticEmitter
class.comment: information about a specific UA emmtter. Section 6.2.2.

attribute.name: acousticSystemName
attribute.comment: the system for a particular UA emitter, and an enumeration

attribute.name: acousticFunction
attribute.comment: The function of the acoustic system

attribute.name: acousticIDNumber
attribute.comment: The UA emitter identification number relative to a specific system

class.name: AggregateIdentifier
class.comment: The unique designation of each aggrgate in an exercise is specified by an aggregate identifier record. The aggregate ID is not an entity and shall not be treated as such. Section 6.2.3.

attribute.name: simulationAddress
attribute.comment: Simulation address, ie site and application, the first two fields of the entity ID

attribute.name: aggregateID
attribute.comment: the aggregate ID

class.name: AggregateMarking
class.comment: Specifies the character set used in the first byte, followed by up to 31 characters of text data. Section 6.2.4.

attribute.name: characterSet
attribute.comment: The character set

attribute.name: characters
attribute.comment: The characters

class.name: AggregateType
class.comment: Identifies the type and organization of an aggregate. Section 6.2.5

attribute.name: aggregateKind
attribute.comment: Grouping criterion used to group the aggregate. Enumeration from EBV document

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc) Zero means domain does not apply.

attribute.name: country
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: category
attribute.comment: category of entity

attribute.name: subcategory
attribute.comment: subcategory of entity

attribute.name: specificInfo
attribute.comment: specific info based on subcategory field. specific is a reserved word in sql.

class.name: AngularVelocityVector
class.comment: Angular velocity measured in radians per second out each of the entity's own coordinate axes. Order of measurement is angular velocity around the x, y, and z axis of the entity. The positive direction is determined by the right hand rule. Section 6.2.7

attribute.name: x
attribute.comment: velocity about the x axis

attribute.name: y
attribute.comment: velocity about the y axis

attribute.name: z
attribute.comment: velocity about the zaxis

class.name: AntennaLocation
class.comment: Location of the radiating portion of the antenna, specified in world coordinates and entity coordinates. Section 6.2.8

attribute.name: antennaLocation
attribute.comment: Location of the radiating portion of the antenna in world coordinates

attribute.name: relativeAntennaLocation
attribute.comment: Location of the radiating portion of the antenna in entity coordinates

class.name: BeamAntennaPattern
class.comment: Used when the antenna pattern type field has a value of 1. Specifies the direction, pattern, and polarization of radiation from an antenna. Section 6.2.9.2

attribute.name: beamDirection
attribute.comment: The rotation that transforms the reference coordinate sytem into the beam coordinate system. Either world coordinates or entity coordinates may be used as the reference coordinate system, as specified by the reference system field of the antenna pattern record.

attribute.name: azimuthBeamwidth
attribute.commment: Full width of the beam to the -3dB power density points in the x-y plane of the beam coordinnate system. Elevation beamwidth is represented by a 32 bit floating point number in units of radians.

attribute.name: elevationBeamwidth
attribute.commment: This field shall specify the full width of the beam to the â€“3 dB power density points in the x-z plane of the beam coordinate system. Elevation beamwidth shall be represented by a 32-bit floating point number in units of radians.

attribute.name: referenceSystem
attribute.commment: The reference coordinate system wrt which beam direction is specified. This field should not change over the duration of an exercise. World coordindate systemis prefered for exercises. The entity coordinate system should be used only when highly directional antennas must be precisely modeled.

attribute.name: ez
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the magnitude of the Z-component (in beam coordinates) of the Electrical field at some arbitrary single point in the main beam and in the far field of the antenna.

attribute.name: ex
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the magnitude of the X-component (in beam coordinates) of the Electri- cal field at some arbitrary single point in the main beam and in the far field of the antenna.

attribute.name: phase
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the phase angle between EZ and EX in radians. If fully omni-direc- tional antenna is modeled using beam pattern type one, the omni-directional antenna shall be repre- sented by beam direction Euler angles psi, theta, and phi of zero, an azimuth beamwidth of 2PI, and an elevation beamwidth of PI

class.name: Association
class.comment: An entity's associations with other entities and/or locations. For each association, this record shall specify the type of the association, the associated entity's EntityID and/or the associated location's world coordinates. This record may be used (optionally) in a transfer transaction to send internal state data from the divesting simulation to the acquiring simulation (see 5.9.4). This record may also be used for other purposes. Section 6.2.9

attribute.name: associationType
attribute.commment: This field shall indicate the type of association. It shall be represented by an 8-bit enumeration. Values for this field are found in Section 14 of SISO-REF-010

attribute.name: associatedEntityID
attribute.comment: identity of associated entity. If none, NO_SPECIFIC_ENTITY

attribute.name: associatedLocation
attribute.comment: location, in world coordinates

class.name: Attribute
class.comment: Used to convey information for one or more attributes. Attributes conform to the standard variable record format of 6.2.82. Section 6.2.10. NOT COMPLETE

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.commment: The record type for this attribute. Enumeration

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.commment: Total length of the record in octets. The record shall end on a 64-bit boundary after any padding. = 6 + K + P

attribute.name: recordSpecificFields
attribute.commment: The attribute data format conforming to that specified by the record type. K bytes long

class.name: BeamData
class.comment: Describes the scan volue of an emitter beam. Section 6.2.11.

attribute.name: beamAzimuthCenter
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam azimuth an elevation centers and corresponding half-angles to describe the scan volume

attribute.name: beamAzimuthSweep
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam azimuth sweep to determine scan volume

attribute.name: beamElevationCenter
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam elevation center to determine scan volume

attribute.name: beamElevationSweep
attribute.comment: Specifies the beam elevation sweep to determine scan volume

attribute.name: beamSweepSync
attribute.comment: allows receiver to synchronize its regenerated scan pattern to that of the emmitter. Specifies the percentage of time a scan is through its pattern from its origion.

class.name: ChangeOptions
class.comment: This is wrong and breaks serialization. See section 6.2.13 aka B.2.41

class.name: BeamStatus
class.comment: Information related to the status of a beam. This is contained in the beam status field of the electromagnitec emission PDU. The first bit determines whether the beam is active (0) or deactivated (1). Section 6.2.12.

attribute.name: beamState
attribute.comment: First bit zero means beam is active, first bit = 1 means deactivated. The rest is padding.

class.name: ClockTime
class.comment: Time measurements that exceed one hour are represented by this record. The first field is the hours since the unix epoch (Jan 1 1970, used by most Unix systems and java) and the second field the timestamp units since the top of the hour. Section 6.2.14

attribute.name: hour
attribute.comment: Hours in UTC

attribute.name: timePastHour
attribute.comment: Time past the hour

class.name: DirectedEnergyDamage
class.comment: Damage sustained by an entity due to directed energy. Location of the damage based on a relative x,y,z location from the center of the entity. Section 6.2.15.2

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: DE Record Type.

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: DE Record Length (bytes).

attribute.name: damageLocation
attribute.comment: location of damage, relative to center of entity

attribute.name: damageDiameter
attribute.comment: Size of damaged area, in meters.

attribute.name: temperature
attribute.comment: average temp of the damaged area, in degrees celsius. If firing entitty does not model this, use a value of -273.15

attribute.name: fireEventID
attribute.comment: For any component damage resulting this field shall be set to the fire event ID from that PDU.

class.name: DataFilterRecord
class.comment: identify which of the optional data fields are contained in the Minefield Data PDU or requested in the Minefield Query PDU. This is a 32-bit record. For each field, true denotes that the data is requested or present and false denotes that the data is neither requested nor present. Section 6.2.16

attribute.name: bitFlags
attribute.comment: Bitflags field

class.name: UnsignedDISInteger
class.comment: container class not in specification

attribute.name: val
attribute.comment: unsigned integer

class.name: DataQueryDatumSpecification
class.comment: List of fixed and variable datum records. Section 6.2.17

attribute.name: numberOfFixedDatums
attribute.comment: Number of fixed datums

attribute.name: numberOfVariableDatums
attribute.comment: Number of variable datums

attribute.name: fixedDatumIDList
attribute.comment: variable length list fixed datum IDs

attribute.name: variableDatumIDList
attribute.comment: variable length list variable datum IDs

class.name: DatumSpecification
class.comment: List of fixed and variable datum records. Section 6.2.18

attribute.name: numberOfFixedDatums
attribute.comment: Number of fixed datums

attribute.name: numberOfVariableDatums
attribute.comment: Number of variable datums

attribute.name: fixedDatumIDList
attribute.comment: variable length list fixed datums

attribute.name: variableDatumIDList
attribute.comment: variable length list variable datums

class.name: MunitionDescriptor
class.comment: Represents the firing or detonation of a munition. Section 6.2.19.2

attribute.name: munitionType
attribute.comment: What munition was used in the burst

attribute.name: warhead
attribute.comment: type of warhead enumeration

attribute.name: fuse
attribute.comment: type of fuse used enumeration

attribute.name: quantity
attribute.comment: how many of the munition were fired

attribute.name: rate
attribute.comment: rate at which the munition was fired

class.name: ExplosionDescriptor
class.comment: Explosion of a non-munition. Section 6.2.19.3

attribute.name: explodingObject
attribute.comment: Type of the object that exploded. See 6.2.30

attribute.name: explosiveMaterial
attribute.comment: Material that exploded. Can be grain dust, tnt, gasoline, etc. Enumeration

attribute.name: explosiveForce
attribute.comment: Force of explosion, in equivalent KG of TNT

class.name: ExpendableDescriptor
class.comment: Burst of chaff or expendible device. Section 6.2.19.4

attribute.name: expendableType

attribute.name: targetSpotLocation
attribute.comment: Position of Target Spot in World Coordinates.

attribute.name: targetSpotEntityLocation
attribute.comment: Position (meters) of Target Spot relative to Entity Position.

attribute.name: targetSpotVelocity

attribute.name: beamSpotType

attribute.name: beamSpotCrossSectionSemiMajorAxis

attribute.name: beamSpotCrossSectionSemiMinorAxis

attribute.comment: Beam Spot Cross Section Orientation Angle.

attribute.comment: Peak irradiance

class.name: BlankingSector
class.comment: The Blanking Sector attribute record may be used to convey persistent areas within a scan volume where emitter power for a specific active emitter beam is reduced to an insignificant value. Section 6.2.21.2

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.commment: record type

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.commment: the length of the Blanking Sector attribute record in octets.

attribute.name: emitterNumber
attribute.commment: indicates the emitter system for which the blanking sector values are applicable

attribute.name: beamNumber
attribute.commment: indicates the beam for which the blanking sector values are applicable.

attribute.name: stateIndicator
attribute.commment: indicate if blanking sector data have changed since issuance of the last Blanking Sector attribute record for this beam, if the Blanking Sector attribute record beam has ceased

attribute.name: leftAzimuth
attribute.commment: This field is provided to indicate the left-most azimuth (clockwise in radians) for which emitted power is reduced. This angle is measured in the X-Y plane of the radar's entity coor- dinate system (see 1.4.3). The range of permissible values is 0 to 2PI, with zero pointing in the X- direction.

attribute.name: rightAzimuth
attribute.commment: Indicate the right-most azimuth (clockwise in radians) for which emitted power is reduced. This angle is measured in the X-Y plane of the radar's entity coordinate system (see 1.4.3). The range of permissible values is 0 to 2PI , with zero pointing in the X- direction.

attribute.name: lowerElevation
attribute.commment: This field is provided to indicate the lowest elevation (in radians) for which emit- ted power is reduced. This angle is measured positive upward with respect to the X-Y plane of the radar's entity coordinate system (see 1.4.3). The range of permissible values is -PI/2 to PI/2

attribute.name: upperElevation
attribute.commment: This field is provided to indicate the highest elevation (in radians) for which emitted power is reduced. This angle is measured positive upward with respect to the X-Y plane of the radar's entitycoordinatesystem(see1.4.3). The range of permissible values is -PI/2 to PI/2

attribute.name: residualPower
attribute.commment: This field shall specify the residual effective radiated power in the blanking sector in dBm.

attribute.name: padding3
attribute.commment: Padding, 32 bits

attribute.name: padding4
attribute.commment: Padding, 32 bits

class.name: AngleDeception
class.comment: The Angle Deception attribute record may be used to communicate discrete values that are associated with angle deception jamming that cannot be referenced to an emitter mode. The values provided in the record records (provided in the associated Electromagnetic Emission PDU). (The victim radar beams are those that are targeted by the jammer.) Section 6.2.21.2.2

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.commment: record type

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.commment: the length of the record in octets.

attribute.name: emitterNumber
attribute.commment: indicates the emitter system for which the angle deception values are applicable.

attribute.name: beamNumber
attribute.commment: indicates the jamming beam for which the angle deception values are applicable.

attribute.name: stateIndicator
attribute.commment: This field shall be used to indicate if angle deception data have changed since issuance of the last Angle Deception attribute record for this beam, if the Angle Deception attribute record is part of a heartbeat update to meet periodic update requirements or if the angle deception data for the beam has ceased.

attribute.name: azimuthOffset
attribute.commment: This field indicates the relative azimuth angle at which the deceptive radar returns are centered. This angle is measured in the X-Y plane of the victim radar's entity coordinate system (see 1.4.3). This angle is measured in radians from the victim radar entity's azimuth for the true jam- mer position to the center of the range of azimuths in which deceptive radar returns are perceived as shown in Figure 43. Positive and negative values indicate that the perceived positions of the jammer are right and left of the true position of the jammer, respectively. The range of permissible values is -PI to PI

attribute.name: azimuthWidth
attribute.commment: indicates the range of azimuths (in radians) through which the deceptive radar returns are perceived, centered on the azimuth offset as shown in Figure 43. The range of permissible values is 0 to 2PI radians

attribute.name: azimuthPullRate
attribute.commment: This field indicates the rate (in radians per second) at which the Azimuth Offset value is changing. Positive and negative values indicate that the Azimuth Offset is moving to the right or left, respectively.

attribute.name: azimuthPullAcceleration
attribute.commment: This field indicates the rate (in radians per second squared) at which the Azimuth Pull Rate value is changing. Azimuth Pull Acceleration is defined as positive to the right and negative to the left.

attribute.name: elevationOffset
attribute.commment: This field indicates the relative elevation angle at which the deceptive radar returns begin. This angle is measured as an angle with respect to the X-Y plane of the victim radar's entity coordinate system (see 1.4.3). This angle is measured in radians from the victim radar entity's eleva- tion for the true jammer position to the center of the range of elevations in which deceptive radar returns are perceived as shown in Figure 44. Positive and negative values indicate that the perceived positions of the jammer are above and below the true position of the jammer, respectively. The range of permissible values is -PI/2 to PI/2

attribute.name: elevationWidth
attribute.commment: This field indicates the range of elevations (in radians) through which the decep- tive radar returns are perceived, centered on the elevation offset as shown in Figure 44. The range of permissible values is 0 to PI radians

attribute.name: elevationPullRate
attribute.commment: This field indicates the rate (in radians per second) at which the Elevation Off- set value is changing. Positive and negative values indicate that the Elevation Offset is moving up or down, respectively.

attribute.name: elevationPullAcceleration
attribute.commment: This field indicates the rate (in radians per second squared) at which the Elevation Pull Rate value is changing. Elevation Pull Acceleration is defined as positive to upward and negative downward.

class.name: FalseTargetsAttribute
class.comment: The False Targets attribute record shall be used to communicate discrete values that are associated with false targets jamming that cannot be referenced to an emitter mode. The values provided in the False Targets attri- bute record shall be considered valid only for the victim radar beams listed in the jamming beam's Track/Jam Data records (provided in the associated Electromagnetic Emission PDU). Section 6.2.21.3

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.commment: record type

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.commment: the length of the record in octets.

attribute.name: emitterNumber
attribute.commment: This field indicates the emitter system generating the false targets.

attribute.name: beamNumber
attribute.commment: This field indicates the jamming beam generating the false targets.

attribute.name: stateIndicator
attribute.commment: This field shall be used to indicate if false target data have changed since issuance of the last False Targets attribute record for this beam, if the False Targets attribute record is part of a heartbeat update to meet periodic update requirements or if false target data for the beam has ceased.

attribute.name: falseTargetCount
attribute.commment: This field indicates the jamming beam generating the false targets.

attribute.name: walkSpeed
attribute.commment: This field shall specify the speed (in meters per second) at which false targets move toward the victim radar. Negative values shall indicate a velocity away from the victim radar.

attribute.name: walkAcceleration
attribute.commment: This field shall specify the rate (in meters per second squared) at which false tar- gets accelerate toward the victim radar. Negative values shall indicate an acceleration direction away from the victim radar.

attribute.name: maximumWalkDistance
attribute.commment: This field shall specify the distance (in meters) that a false target is to walk before it pauses in range.

attribute.name: keepTime
attribute.commment: This field shall specify the time (in seconds) that a false target is to be held at the Maxi- mum Walk Distance before it resets to its initial position.

attribute.name: echoSpacing
attribute.commment: TThis field shall specify the distance between false targets in meters. Positive values for this field shall indicate that second and subsequent false targets are initially placed at increasing ranges from the victim radar.

class.name: EEFundamentalParameterData
class.comment: Contains electromagnetic emmission regeneration parameters that are variable throught a scenario. Section 6.2.22.

attribute.name: frequency
attribute.comment: center frequency of the emission in hertz.

attribute.name: frequencyRange
attribute.comment: Bandwidth of the frequencies corresponding to the fequency field.

attribute.name: effectiveRadiatedPower
attribute.comment: Effective radiated power for the emission in DdBm. For a radar noise jammer, indicates the peak of the transmitted power.

attribute.name: pulseRepetitionFrequency
attribute.comment: Average repetition frequency of the emission in hertz.

attribute.name: pulseWidth
attribute.comment: Average pulse width of the emission in microseconds.

attribute.comment: Simulation address (site and application number)

attribute.name: groupNumber
attribute.comment: group number

class.name: IFFData
class.comment: repeating element if IFF Data specification record

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: enumeration for type of record

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: length of record. Should be padded to 32 bit boundary.

attribute.name: iffData
attribute.comment: IFF data.

class.name: IffDataSpecification
class.comment: Requires hand coding to be useful. Section 6.2.43

attribute.name: numberOfIffDataRecords
attribute.comment: Number of iff records

attribute.name: iffDataRecords
attribute.comment: IFF data records

class.name: IFFFundamentalParameterData
class.comment: Fundamental IFF atc data. Section 6.2.45

attribute.name: pulseWidth
attribute.comment: Pulse width

attribute.name: burstLength
attribute.comment: Burst length

attribute.name: applicableModes
attribute.comment: Applicable modes enumeration

attribute.name: systemSpecificData
attribute.comment: System-specific data

class.name: IntercomCommunicationsParameters
class.comment: Intercom communcations parameters. Section 6.2.47. This requires hand coding

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: Type of intercom parameters record

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: length of record

attribute.name: recordSpecificField
attribute.comment: This is a placeholder.

class.name: IntercomIdentifier
class.comment: Unique designation of an attached or unattached intercom in an event or exercirse. Section 6.2.48

class.name: IOCommunicationsNode
class.comment: A communications node that is part of a simulted communcations network. Section 6.2.49.2

class.name: IOEffect
class.comment: Effect of IO on an entity. Section 6.2.49.3

class.name: CommunicationsNodeID
class.comment: Identity of a communications node. Section 6.2.48.4

class.name: JammingTechnique
class.comment: Jamming technique. Section 6.2.49

class.name: LaunchedMunitionRecord
class.comment: Identity of a communications node. Section 6.2.50

class.name: LayerHeader
class.comment: The identification of the additional information layer number, layer-specific information, and the length of the layer. Section 6.2.51

attribute.name: layerSpecificInformation
attribute.comment: field shall specify layer-specific information that varies by System Type (see 6.2.86) and Layer Number.

attribute.name: length
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the length in octets of the layer, including the Layer Header record

class.name: LinearSegmentParameter
class.comment: The specification of an individual segment of a linear segment synthetic environment object in a Linear Object State PDU Section 6.2.52

attribute.name: segmentNumber
attribute.comment: the individual segment of the linear segment

attribute.name: segmentModification
attribute.comment: whether a modification has been made to the point objectâ€™s location or orientation

attribute.name: generalSegmentAppearance
attribute.comment: general dynamic appearance attributes of the segment. This record shall be defined as a 16-bit record of enumerations. The values defined for this record are included in Section 12 of SISO-REF-010.

attribute.name: specificSegmentAppearance
attribute.comment: This field shall specify specific dynamic appearance attributes of the segment. This record shall be defined as a 32-bit record of enumerations.

attribute.name: segmentLocation
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the location of the linear segment in the simulated world and shall be represented by a World Coordinates record

attribute.name: segmentOrientation
attribute.comment: orientation of the linear segment about the segment location and shall be represented by a Euler Angles record

attribute.name: segmentLength
attribute.comment: length of the linear segment, in meters, extending in the positive X direction

attribute.name: segmentWidth
attribute.comment: The total width of the linear segment, in meters, shall be specified by a 16-bit unsigned integer. One-half of the width shall extend in the positive Y direction, and one-half of the width shall extend in the negative Y direction.

attribute.name: segmentHeight
attribute.comment: The height of the linear segment, in meters, above ground shall be specified by a 16-bit unsigned integer.

attribute.name: segmentDepth
attribute.comment: The depth of the linear segment, in meters, below ground level

class.name: LiveEntityIdentifier
class.comment: The unique designation of each entity in an event or exercise that is contained in a Live Entity PDU. Section 6.2.54

attribute.name: liveSimulationAddress
attribute.comment: Live Simulation Address record (see 6.2.54)

attribute.name: entityNumber
attribute.comment: Live entity number

class.name: LiveSimulationAddress
class.comment: A simulation's designation associated with all Live Entity IDs contained in Live Entity PDUs. Section 6.2.55

attribute.name: liveSiteNumber
attribute.comment: facility, installation, organizational unit or geographic location may have multiple sites associated with it. The Site Number is the first component of the Live Simulation Address, which defines a live simulation.

attribute.name: liveApplicationNumber
attribute.comment: An application associated with a live site is termed a live application. Each live application participating in an event

class.name: MineEntityIdentifier
class.comment: The unique designation of a mine contained in the Minefield Data PDU. No espdus are issued for mine entities. Section 6.2.55

class.name: MinefieldIdentifier
class.comment: The unique designation of a minefield Section 6.2.56

class.name: MinefieldSensorType
class.comment: Information about a minefield sensor. Section 6.2.57

attribute.name: sensorType
attribute.comment: sensor type. bit fields 0-3 are the type category, 4-15 are teh subcategory

class.name: ModulationParameters
class.comment: Modulation parameters associated with a specific radio system. INCOMPLETE. 6.2.58

class.name: ModulationType
class.comment: Information about the type of modulation used for radio transmission. 6.2.59

attribute.name: spreadSpectrum
attribute.comment: This field shall indicate the spread spectrum technique or combination of spread spectrum techniques in use. Bit field. 0=freq hopping, 1=psuedo noise, time hopping=2, reamining bits unused

attribute.name: majorModulation
attribute.comment: the major classification of the modulation type.

attribute.name: detail
attribute.comment: provide certain detailed information depending upon the major modulation type

attribute.name: radioSystem
attribute.comment: the radio system associated with this Transmitter PDU and shall be used as the basis to interpret other fields whose values depend on a specific radio system.

class.name: Munition
class.comment: An entity's munition (e.g., bomb, missile) information shall be represented by one or more Munition records. For each type or location of munition, this record shall specify the type, location, quantity and status of munitions that an entity contains. Section 6.2.60

attribute.name: munitionType
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the entity type of the munition. See section 6.2.30.

attribute.name: station
attribute.comment: the station or launcher to which the munition is assigned. See Annex I

attribute.name: quantity
attribute.comment: the quantity remaining of this munition.

attribute.name: munitionStatus
attribute.comment: the status of the munition. It shall be represented by an 8-bit enumeration.

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: padding

class.name: MunitionReload
class.comment: indicate weapons (munitions) previously communicated via the Munition record. Section 6.2.61

attribute.name: munitionType
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the entity type of the munition. See section 6.2.30.

attribute.name: station
attribute.comment: the station or launcher to which the munition is assigned. See Annex I

attribute.name: standardQuantity
attribute.comment: the standard quantity of this munition type normally loaded at this station/launcher if a station/launcher is specified.

attribute.name: maximumQuantity
attribute.comment: the maximum quantity of this munition type that this station/launcher is capable of holding when a station/launcher is specified

attribute.name: standardQuantityReloadTime
attribute.comment: numer of seconds of sim time required to reload the std qty

attribute.name: maximumQuantityReloadTime
attribute.comment: the number of seconds of sim time required to reload the max possible quantity

class.name: NamedLocationIdentification
class.comment: Information about the discrete positional relationship of the part entity with respect to the its host entity Section 6.2.62

attribute.name: stationName
attribute.comment: the station name within the host at which the part entity is located. If the part entity is On Station, this field shall specify the representation of the partâ€™s location data fields. This field shall be specified by a 16-bit enumeration

attribute.name: stationNumber
attribute.comment: the number of the particular wing station, cargo hold etc., at which the part is attached.

class.name: ObjectIdentifier
class.comment: The unique designation of an environmental object. Section 6.2.63

attribute.name: simulationAddress
attribute.comment: Simulation Address

attribute.name: objectNumber
attribute.comment: object number

class.name: ObjectType
class.comment: The unique designation of an environmental object. Section 6.2.64

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc)

attribute.name: objectKind
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: category
attribute.comment: category of entity

attribute.name: subcategory
attribute.comment: subcategory of entity

class.name: OwnershipStatus
class.comment: used to convey entity and conflict status information associated with transferring ownership of an entity. Section 6.2.65

attribute.name: ownershipStatus
attribute.comment: The ownership and/or ownership conflict status of the entity represented by the Entity ID field.

class.name: PduHeader
class.comment: Not used. The PDU Header Record is directly incoroporated into the PDU class. Here for completness only. Section 6.2.66

attribute.name: protocolVersion
attribute.comment: The version of the protocol. 5=DIS-1995, 6=DIS-1998, 7=DIS-2009.

attribute.name: exerciseID
attribute.comment: Exercise ID

attribute.name: pduType
attribute.comment: Type of pdu, unique for each PDU class

attribute.name: protocolFamily
attribute.comment: value that refers to the protocol family, eg SimulationManagement, etc

attribute.name: timestamp
attribute.comment: Timestamp value

attribute.name: pduLength
attribute.comment: Length, in bytes, of the PDU. Changed name from length to avoid use of Hibernate QL reserved word.

attribute.name: pduStatus
attribute.comment: PDU Status Record. Described in 6.2.67. This field is not present in earlier DIS versions

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero filled array of padding

class.name: PduStatus
class.comment: PDU Status. These are a series of bit fields. Represented here as just a byte. Section 6.2.67

attribute.name: pduStatus
attribute.comment: Bit fields. The semantics of the bit fields depend on the PDU type

class.name: PropulsionSystemData
class.comment: contains information describing the propulsion systems of the entity. This information shall be provided for each active propulsion system defined. Section 6.2.68

attribute.name: engineRpm
attribute.comment: engine RPMs

class.name: ProtocolMode
class.comment: Bit field used to identify minefield data. bits 14-15 are a 2-bit enum, other bits unused. Section 6.2.69

attribute.name: protocolMode
attribute.comment: Bitfields, 14-15 contain an enum

class.name: RadioIdentifier
class.comment: The unique designation of an attached or unattached radio in an event or exercise Section 6.2.70

attribute.name: siteNumber
attribute.comment: site

attribute.name: applicationNumber
attribute.comment: application number

attribute.name: referenceNumber
attribute.comment: reference number

attribute.name: radioNumber
attribute.comment: Radio number

class.name: RadioType
class.comment: Identifies the type of radio. Section 6.2.71

attribute.name: entityKind
attribute.comment: Kind of entity

attribute.name: domain
attribute.comment: Domain of entity (air, surface, subsurface, space, etc)

attribute.name: country
attribute.comment: country to which the design of the entity is attributed

attribute.name: category
attribute.comment: category of entity

attribute.name: subcategory
attribute.comment: specific info based on subcategory field

class.name: RecordQuerySpecification
class.comment: The identification of the records being queried 6.2.72

attribute.name: records
attribute.comment: variable length list of 32 bit records

class.name: RecordSpecificationElement
class.comment: Synthetic record, made up from section 6.2.72. This is used to acheive a repeating variable list element.

attribute.name: recordID
attribute.comment: the data structure used to convey the parameter values of the record for each record. 32 bit enumeration.

attribute.name: recordSetSerialNumber
attribute.comment: the serial number of the first record in the block of records

attribute.name: recordLength
attribute.comment: the length, in bits, of the record. Note, bits, not bytes.

attribute.name: recordCount
attribute.comment: the number of records included in the record set

attribute.name: recordValues
attribute.comment: the concatenated records of the format specified by the Record ID field. The length of this field is the Record Length multiplied by the Record Count, in units of bits. ^^^This is wrong--variable sized data records, bit values. THis MUST be patched after generation.

attribute.name: pad4
attribute.comment: Padding of 0 to 31 unused bits as required for 32-bit alignment of the Record Set field. ^^^This is wrong--variable sized padding. MUST be patched post-code generation

class.name: RecordSpecification
class.comment: This record shall specify the number of record sets contained in the Record Specification record and the record details. Section 6.2.73.

attribute.name: numberOfRecordSets
attribute.comment: The number of record sets

attribute.name: recordSets
attribute.comment: variable length list record specifications.

class.name: Relationship
class.comment: The relationship of the part entity to its host entity. Section 6.2.74.

attribute.name: nature
attribute.comment: the nature or purpose for joining of the part entity to the host entity and shall be represented by a 16-bit enumeration

attribute.name: position
attribute.comment: the position of the part entity with respect to the host entity and shall be represented by a 16-bit enumeration

class.name: RequestID
class.comment: A monotonically increasing number inserted into all simulation managment PDUs. This should be a hand-coded thingie, maybe a singleton. Section 6.2.75

attribute.name: requestID
attribute.comment: monotonically increasing number

class.name: SecondaryOperationalData
class.comment: Additional operational data for an IFF emitting system and the number of IFF Fundamental Parameter Data records Section 6.2.76.

attribute.name: operationalData1
attribute.comment: additional operational characteristics of the IFF emitting system. Each 8-bit field will vary depending on the system type.

attribute.name: operationalData2
attribute.comment: additional operational characteristics of the IFF emitting system. Each 8-bit field will vary depending on the system type.

attribute.name: numberOfIFFFundamentalParameterRecords
attribute.comment: the number of IFF Fundamental Parameter Data records that follow

class.name: Sensor
class.comment: An entity's sensor information. Section 6.2.77.

attribute.name: sensorTypeSource
attribute.comment: the source of the Sensor Type field

attribute.name: sensorOnOffStatus
attribute.comment: the on/off status of the sensor

attribute.name: sensorType
attribute.comment: the sensor type and shall be represented by a 16-bit enumeration.

attribute.name: station
attribute.comment: the station to which the sensor is assigned. A zero value shall indi- cate that this Sensor record is not associated with any particular station and represents the total quan- tity of this sensor for this entity. If this field is non-zero, it shall either reference an attached part or an articulated part

attribute.name: quantity
attribute.comment: quantity of the sensor

class.name: SilentEntitySystem
class.comment: information abou an enitity not producing espdus. Section 6.2.79

attribute.name: numberOfEntities
attribute.comment: number of the type specified by the entity type field

attribute.name: numberOfAppearanceRecords
attribute.comment: number of entity appearance records that follow

attribute.name: entityType
attribute.comment: Entity type

attribute.name: appearanceRecordList
attribute.comment: Variable length list of appearance records

class.name: SimulationAddress
class.comment: A Simulation Address record shall consist of the Site Identification number and the Application Identification number. Section 6.2.79

attribute.name: site
attribute.comment: A site is defined as a facility, installation, organizational unit or a geographic location that has one or more simulation applications capable of participating in a distributed event.

attribute.name: application
attribute.comment: An application is defined as a software program that is used to generate and process distributed simulation data including live, virtual and constructive data.

class.name: SimulationIdentifier
class.comment: The unique designation of a simulation when using the 48-bit identifier format shall be specified by the Sim- ulation Identifier record. The reason that the 48-bit format is required in addition to the 32-bit simulation address format that actually identifies a specific simulation is because some 48-bit identifier fields in PDUs may contain either an Object Identifier, such as an Entity ID, or a Simulation Identifier. Section 6.2.80

attribute.name: simulationAddress
attribute.comment: Simulation address

attribute.name: referenceNumber
attribute.comment: This field shall be set to zero as there is no reference number associated with a Simulation Identifier.

class.name: SimulationManagementPduHeader
class.comment: First part of a simulation management (SIMAN) PDU and SIMAN-Reliability (SIMAN-R) PDU. Sectionn 6.2.81

attribute.name: pduHeader
attribute.comment: Conventional PDU header

attribute.name: originatingID
attribute.comment: IDs the simulation or entity, etiehr a simulation or an entity. Either 6.2.80 or 6.2.28

attribute.name: receivingID
attribute.comment: simulation, all simulations, a special ID, or an entity. See 5.6.5 and 5.12.4

class.name: StandardVariableSpecification
class.comment: Does not work, and causes failure in anything it is embedded in. Section 6.2.83

attribute.name: numberOfStandardVariableRecords
attribute.comment: Number of static variable records

attribute.name: standardVariables
attribute.comment: variable length list of standard variables, The class type and length here are WRONG and will cause the incorrect serialization of any class in whihc it is embedded.

class.name: StorageFuel
class.comment: Information about an entity's engine fuel. Section 6.2.84.

attribute.name: fuelQuantity
attribute.comment: Fuel quantity, units specified by next field

attribute.name: fuelMeasurementUnits
attribute.comment: Units in which the fuel is measured

attribute.name: fuelType
attribute.comment: Type of fuel

attribute.name: fuelLocation
attribute.comment: Location of fuel as related to entity. See section 14 of EBV document

class.name: StorageFuelReload
class.comment: For each type or location of Storage Fuel, this record shall specify the type, location, fuel measure- ment units, reload quantity and maximum quantity for storage fuel either for the whole entity or a specific storage fuel location (tank). Section 6.2.85.

attribute.name: standardQuantity
attribute.comment: the standard quantity of this fuel type normally loaded at this station/launcher if a station/launcher is specified. If the Station/Launcher field is set to zero, then this is the total quantity of this fuel type that would be present in a standard reload of all appli- cable stations/launchers associated with this entity.

attribute.name: maximumQuantity
attribute.comment: the maximum quantity of this fuel type that this sta- tion/launcher is capable of holding when a station/launcher is specified. This would be the value used when a maximum reload was desired to be set for this station/launcher. If the Station/launcher field is set to zero, then this is the maximum quantity of this fuel type that would be present on this entity at all stations/launchers that can accept this fuel type.

attribute.name: standardQuantityReloadTime
attribute.comment: the seconds normally required to reload the standard quantity of this fuel type at this specific station/launcher. When the Station/Launcher field is set to zero, this shall be the time it takes to perform a standard quantity reload of this fuel type at all applicable stations/launchers for this entity.

attribute.name: maximumQuantityReloadTime
attribute.comment: the seconds normally required to reload the maximum possible quantity of this fuel type at this station/launcher. When the Station/Launcher field is set to zero, this shall be the time it takes to perform a maximum quantity load/reload of this fuel type at all applicable stations/launchers for this entity.

attribute.name: fuelMeasurementUnits
attribute.comment: the fuel measurement units. Enumeration

attribute.name: fuelType
attribute.comment: Fuel type. Enumeration

attribute.name: fuelLocation
attribute.comment: Location of fuel as related to entity. See section 14 of EBV document

class.name: SupplyQuantity
class.comment: A supply, and the amount of that supply. Section 6.2.86

attribute.name: supplyType
attribute.comment: Type of supply

attribute.name: quantity
attribute.comment: the number of units of a supply type.

class.name: SystemIdentifier
class.comment: The ID of the IFF emitting system. NOT COMPLETE. Section 6.2.87

attribute.name: systemType
attribute.comment: general type of emitting system, an enumeration

attribute.name: systemName
attribute.comment: named type of system, an enumeration

attribute.name: systemMode
attribute.comment: mode of operation for the system, an enumeration

attribute.name: changeOptions
attribute.comment: status of this PDU, see section 6.2.15

class.name: TotalRecordSets
class.comment: Total number of record sets contained in a logical set of one or more PDUs. Used to transfer ownership, etc Section 6.2.88

attribute.name: totalRecordSets
attribute.comment: Total number of record sets

class.name: TrackJamData
class.comment: Track-Jam data Section 6.2.89

attribute.name: entityID
attribute.comment: the entity tracked or illumated, or an emitter beam targeted with jamming

attribute.name: emitterNumber
attribute.comment: Emitter system associated with the entity

attribute.name: beamNumber
attribute.comment: Beam associated with the entity

class.name: UAFundamentalParameter
class.comment: Regeneration parameters for active emission systems that are variable throughout a scenario. Section 6.2.91

attribute.name: activeEmissionParameterIndex
attribute.comment: Which database record shall be used. An enumeration from EBV document

attribute.name: scanPattern
attribute.comment: The type of scan pattern, If not used, zero. An enumeration from EBV document

attribute.name: beamCenterAzimuthHorizontal
attribute.comment: center azimuth bearing of th emain beam. In radians.

attribute.name: azimuthalBeamwidthHorizontal
attribute.comment: Horizontal beamwidth of th emain beam Meastued at the 3dB down point of peak radiated power. In radians.

attribute.name: beamCenterDepressionElevation
attribute.comment: center of the d/e angle of th emain beam relative to the stablised de angle of the target. In radians.

attribute.name: beamwidthDownElevation
attribute.comment: vertical beamwidth of the main beam. Meastured at the 3dB down point of peak radiated power. In radians.

class.name: UnattachedIdentifier

attribute.name: referenceNumber
attribute.comment: Reference number

class.name: VariableDatum

attribute.comment: Type of variable datum to be transmitted. 32 bit enumeration defined in EBV

attribute.name: variableDatumLength
attribute.comment: Length, IN BITS, of the variable datum.

attribute.name: variableDatumBits
attribute.comment: Variable datum. This can be any number of bits long, depending on the datum.

class.name: VariableParameter

attribute.name: recordType
attribute.comment: the identification of the Variable Parameter record. Enumeration from EBV

attribute.name: variableParameterFields1
attribute.comment: Variable parameter data fields. Two doubles minus one byte

attribute.name: variableParameterFields2
attribute.comment: Variable parameter data fields.

attribute.name: variableParameterFields3
attribute.comment: Variable parameter data fields.

attribute.name: variableParameterFields4
attribute.comment: Variable parameter data fields.

attribute.name: parameterType

attribute.name: parameterValue
attribute.comment: The definition of the 64 bits shall be determined based on the type of parameter specified in the Parameter Type field

attribute.name: partAttachedTo

attribute.name: parameterType
attribute.comment: The location or station to which the part is attached

attribute.name: parameterValue
attribute.comment: The definition of the 64 bits shall be determined based on the type of parameter specified in the Parameter Type field

attribute.name: changeIndicator
attribute.comment: Indicates if this VP has changed since last issuance

attribute.name: stationLocation
attribute.comment: Station separated from

attribute.name: recordType

attribute.comment: Length, in bytes

class.comment: Non-DIS class, used to describe streams of PDUS when logging data to a SQL database. This is not in the DIS standard but can be helpful when logging to a Hibernate sql database

attribute.name: name

class.name: PduSuperclass
class.comment: The superclass for all PDUs, including classic and Live Entity (LE) PDUs. This incorporates the PduHeader record, section 7.2.2

attribute.name: protocolVersion
attribute.comment: The version of the protocol. 5=DIS-1995, 6=DIS-1998, 7=DIS-2009.

attribute.name: exerciseID
attribute.comment: Exercise ID

attribute.name: pduType
attribute.comment: Type of pdu, unique for each PDU class

attribute.name: protocolFamily
attribute.comment: value that refers to the protocol family, eg SimulationManagement, et

attribute.name: timestamp
attribute.comment: Timestamp value

attribute.name: length
attribute.comment: Length, in bytes, of the PDU

class.name: Pdu
class.comment: Adds some fields to the the classic PDU

attribute.comment: PDU Status Record. Described in 6.2.67. This field is not present in earlier DIS versions

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding

class.name: LiveEntityPdu
class.comment: The live entity PDUs have a header with some different field names, but the same length. Section 9.3.2

attribute.comment: Subprotocol used to decode the PDU. Section 13 of EBV.

attribute.name: padding
attribute.comment: zero-filled array of padding

class.name: EntityInformationFamilyPdu
class.comment: Section 5.3.3. Common superclass for EntityState, Collision, collision-elastic, and entity state update PDUs. This should be abstract. COMPLETE

class.name: EntityStatePdu
class.comment: Represents the postion and state of one entity in the world. Section 7.2.2. COMPLETE

attribute.name: entityID
attribute.comment: Unique ID for an entity that is tied to this state information

attribute.name: forceId
attribute.comment: What force this entity is affiliated with, eg red, blue, neutral, etc

attribute.name: numberOfVariableParameters
attribute.comment: How many variable parameters are in the variable length list. In earlier versions of DIS these were known as articulation parameters

attribute.name: entityType
attribute.comment: Describes the type of entity in the world

attribute.name: entityLinearVelocity
attribute.comment: Describes the speed of the entity in the world

attribute.name: entityLocation
attribute.comment: describes the location of the entity in the world

attribute.name: entityOrientation
attribute.comment: describes the orientation of the entity, in euler angles

attribute.name: entityAppearance
attribute.comment: a series of bit flags that are used to help draw the entity, such as smoking, on fire, etc.

flag.name: damage
flag.comment: 0 no damage, 1 slight damage, 2 moderate, 3 destroyed

flag.name: smoke
flag.comment: 0 no smoke, 1 smoke plume, 2 engine smoke, 3 engine smoke and plume

flag.name: trailingEffects
flag.comment: dust cloud, 0 none 1 small 2 medium 3 large

flag.name: hatch
flag.comment: 0 NA 1 closed popped 3 popped and person visible 4 open 5 open and person visible

attribute.name: deadReckoningParameters
attribute.comment: parameters used for dead reckoning

attribute.name: marking
attribute.comment: characters that can be used for debugging, or to draw unique strings on the side of entities in the world

attribute.name: capabilities
attribute.comment: a series of bit flags

attribute.name: variableParameters
attribute.comment: variable length list of variable parameters. In earlier DIS versions this was articulation parameters.

class.name: CollisionPdu
class.comment: Section 7.2.3 Collisions between entities shall be communicated by issuing a Collision PDU. COMPLETE

attribute.name: issuingEntityID
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the entity that is issuing the PDU, and shall be represented by an Entity Identifier record (see 6.2.28).

attribute.name: collidingEntityID
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the entity that has collided with the issuing entity (see 5.3.3.4). This field shall be represented by an Entity Identifier record (see 6.2.28).

attribute.name: eventID
attribute.comment: This field shall contain an identification generated by the issuing simulation application to associate related collision events. This field shall be represented by an Event Identifier record (see 6.2.34).

attribute.name: collisionType
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the type of collision. The Collision Type field shall be represented by an 8-bit record of enumerations

attribute.name: pad
attribute.comment: some padding

attribute.name: velocity
attribute.comment: This field shall contain the velocity (at the time the collision is detected) of the issuing entity. The velocity shall be represented in world coordinates. This field shall be represented by the Linear Velocity Vector record [see 6.2.95 item c)].

attribute.name: mass
attribute.comment: This field shall contain the mass of the issuing entity, and shall be represented by a 32-bit floating point number representing kilograms.

attribute.name: location
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the location of the collision with respect to the entity with which the issuing entity collided. The Location field shall be represented by an Entity Coordinate Vector record [see 6.2.95 item a)].

class.name: CollisionElasticPdu
class.comment: Information about elastic collisions in a DIS exercise shall be communicated using a Collision-Elastic PDU. Section 7.2.4. COMPLETE

attribute.name: issuingEntityID
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the entity that is issuing the PDU and shall be represented by an Entity Identifier record (see 6.2.28)

attribute.name: collidingEntityID
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the entity that has collided with the issuing entity. This field shall be a valid identifier of an entity or server capable of responding to the receipt of this Collision-Elastic PDU. This field shall be represented by an Entity Identifier record (see 6.2.28).

attribute.name: collisionEventID
attribute.comment: This field shall contain an identification generated by the issuing simulation application to associate related collision events. This field shall be represented by an Event Identifier record (see 6.2.34).

attribute.name: pad
attribute.comment: some padding

attribute.name: contactVelocity
attribute.comment: This field shall contain the velocity at the time the collision is detected at the point the collision is detected. The velocity shall be represented in world coordinates. This field shall be represented by the Linear Velocity Vector record [see 6.2.95 item c)]

attribute.name: mass
attribute.comment: This field shall contain the mass of the issuing entity and shall be represented by a 32-bit floating point number representing kilograms

attribute.name: locationOfImpact
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the location of the collision with respect to the entity with which the issuing entity collided. This field shall be represented by an Entity Coordinate Vector record [see 6.2.95 item a)].

attribute.name: collisionIntermediateResultXX
attribute.comment: These six records represent the six independent components of a positive semi-definite matrix formed by pre-multiplying and post-multiplying the tensor of inertia, by the anti-symmetric matrix generated by the moment arm, and shall be represented by 32-bit floating point numbers (see 5.3.4.4)

attribute.name: collisionIntermediateResultXY
attribute.comment: tensor values

attribute.name: collisionIntermediateResultXZ
attribute.comment: tensor values

attribute.name: collisionIntermediateResultYY
attribute.comment: tensor values

attribute.name: collisionIntermediateResultYZ
attribute.comment: tensor values

attribute.name: collisionIntermediateResultZZ
attribute.comment: tensor values

attribute.name: unitSurfaceNormal
attribute.comment: This record shall represent the normal vector to the surface at the point of collision detection. The surface normal shall be represented in world coordinates. This field shall be represented by an Entity Coordinate Vector record [see 6.2.95 item a)].

attribute.name: coefficientOfRestitution
attribute.comment: This field shall represent the degree to which energy is conserved in a collision and shall be represented by a 32-bit floating point number. In addition, it represents a free parameter by which simulation application developers may â€œtuneâ€ their collision interactions.

class.name: EntityStateUpdatePdu
class.comment: Nonstatic information about a particular entity may be communicated by issuing an Entity State Update PDU. Section 7.2.5. COMPLETE

attribute.name: entityID
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the entity issuing the PDU, and shall be represented by an Entity Identifier record (see 6.2.28).

attribute.name: numberOfVariableParameters
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the number of variable parameters present. This field shall be represented by an 8-bit unsigned integer (see Annex I).

attribute.name: entityLinearVelocity
attribute.comment: This field shall specify an entityâ€™s linear velocity. The coordinate system for an entityâ€™s linear velocity depends on the dead reckoning algorithm used. This field shall be represented by a Linear Velocity Vector record [see 6.2.95 item c)]).

attribute.name: entityLocation
attribute.comment: This field shall specify an entityâ€™s physical location in the simulated world and shall be represented by a World Coordinates record (see 6.2.97).

attribute.name: entityOrientation
attribute.comment: This field shall specify an entityâ€™s orientation and shall be represented by an Euler Angles record (see 6.2.33).

attribute.name: entityAppearance
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the dynamic changes to the entityâ€™s appearance attributes. This field shall be represented by an Entity Appearance record (see 6.2.26).

flag.name: damage
flag.comment: 0 no damage, 1 slight damage, 2 moderate, 3 destroyed

flag.name: smoke
flag.comment: 0 no smoke, 1 smoke plume, 2 engine smoke, 3 engine smoke and plume

flag.name: trailingEffects
flag.comment: dust cloud, 0 none 1 small 2 medium 3 large

flag.name: hatch
flag.comment: 0 NA 1 closed popped 3 popped and person visible 4 open 5 open and person visible

attribute.name: variableParameters
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the parameter values for each Variable Parameter record that is included (see 6.2.93 and Annex I).

class.name: AttributePdu
class.comment: Information about individual attributes for a particular entity, other object, or event may be communicated using an Attribute PDU. The Attribute PDU shall not be used to exchange data available in any other PDU except where explicitly mentioned in the PDU issuance instructions within this standard. See 5.3.6 for the information requirements and issuance and receipt rules for this PDU. Section 7.2.6. INCOMPLETE

attribute.name: originatingSimulationAddress
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the simulation issuing the Attribute PDU. It shall be represented by a Simulation Address record (see 6.2.79).

attribute.name: attributeRecordPduType
attribute.comment: This field shall represent the type of the PDU that is being extended or updated, if applicable. It shall be represented by an 8-bit enumeration.

attribute.name: attributeRecordProtocolVersion
attribute.comment: This field shall indicate the Protocol Version associated with the Attribute Record PDU Type. It shall be represented by an 8-bit enumeration.

attribute.name: masterAttributeRecordType
attribute.comment: This field shall contain the Attribute record type of the Attribute records in the PDU if they all have the same Attribute record type. It shall be represented by a 32-bit enumeration.

attribute.name: actionCode
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the action code applicable to this Attribute PDU. The Action Code shall apply to all Attribute records contained in the PDU. It shall be represented by an 8-bit enumeration.

attribute.name: numberAttributeRecordSet
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the number of Attribute Record Sets that make up the remainder of the PDU. It shall be represented by a 16-bit unsigned integer.

class.name: WarfareFamilyPdu
class.comment: abstract superclass for fire and detonation pdus that have shared information. Section 7.3 COMPLETE

attribute.name: firingEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of the entity that shot

attribute.name: targetEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of the entity that is being shot at

class.name: FirePdu
class.comment: The firing of a weapon or expendable shall be communicated by issuing a Fire PDU. Sectioin 7.3.2. COMPLETE

attribute.name: munitionExpendibleID
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the entity identification of the fired munition or expendable. This field shall be represented by an Entity Identifier record (see 6.2.28).

attribute.name: eventID
attribute.comment: This field shall contain an identification generated by the firing entity to associate related firing and detonation events. This field shall be represented by an Event Identifier record (see 6.2.34).

attribute.name: fireMissionIndex
attribute.comment: This field shall identify the fire mission (see 5.4.3.3). This field shall be representedby a 32-bit unsigned integer.

attribute.name: locationInWorldCoordinates
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the location, in world coordinates, from which the munition was launched, and shall be represented by a World Coordinates record (see 6.2.97).

attribute.name: descriptor
attribute.comment: This field shall describe the firing or launch of a munition or expendable represented by one of the following types of Descriptor records: Munition Descriptor (6.2.20.2) or Expendable Descriptor (6.2.20.4).

attribute.name: velocity
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the velocity of the fired munition at the point when the issuing simulation application intends the externally visible effects of the launch (e.g. exhaust plume or muzzle blast) to first become apparent. The velocity shall be represented in world coordinates. This field shall be represented by a Linear Velocity Vector record [see 6.2.95 item c)].

attribute.name: range
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the range that an entityâ€™s fire control system has assumed in computing the fire control solution. This field shall be represented by a 32-bit floating point number in meters. For systems where range is unknown or unavailable, this field shall contain a value of zero.

class.name: DetonationPdu
class.comment: Detonation or impact of munitions, as well as, non-munition explosions, the burst or initial bloom of chaff, and the ignition of a flare shall be indicated. Section 7.3.3 COMPLETE

attribute.name: explodingEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of the expendable entity, Section 7.3.3

attribute.name: eventID
attribute.comment: ID of event, Section 7.3.3

attribute.name: velocity
attribute.comment: velocity of the munition immediately before detonation/impact, Section 7.3.3

attribute.name: locationInWorldCoordinates
attribute.comment: location of the munition detonation, the expendable detonation, Section 7.3.3

attribute.name: descriptor
attribute.comment: Describes the detonation represented, Section 7.3.3

attribute.name: locationOfEntityCoordinates
attribute.comment: Velocity of the ammunition, Section 7.3.3

attribute.name: detonationResult
attribute.comment: result of the detonation, Section 7.3.3

attribute.name: numberOfVariableParameters
attribute.comment: How many articulation parameters we have, Section 7.3.3

attribute.name: variableParameters
attribute.comment: specify the parameter values for each Variable Parameter record, Section 7.3.3

class.name: DirectedEnergyFirePdu
class.comment: Firing of a directed energy weapon shall be communicated by issuing a Directed Energy Fire PDU Section 7.3.4 COMPLETE

attribute.name: munitionType
attribute.comment: Field shall identify the munition type enumeration for the DE weapon beam, Section 7.3.4

attribute.name: shotStartTime
attribute.comment: Field shall indicate the simulation time at start of the shot, Section 7.3.4

attribute.name: commulativeShotTime
attribute.comment: Field shall indicate the current cumulative duration of the shot, Section 7.3.4

attribute.name: ApertureEmitterLocation
attribute.comment: Field shall identify the location of the DE weapon aperture/emitter, Section 7.3.4

attribute.name: apertureDiameter
attribute.comment: Field shall identify the beam diameter at the aperture/emitter, Section 7.3.4

attribute.name: wavelength
attribute.comment: Field shall identify the emissions wavelength in units of meters, Section 7.3.4

attribute.name: peakIrradiance
attribute.comment: Field shall identify the current peak irradiance of emissions in units of Watts per square meter, Section 7.3.4

attribute.name: pulseRepetitionFrequency
attribute.comment: field shall identify the current pulse repetition frequency in units of cycles per second (Hertz), Section 7.3.4

attribute.name: pulseWidth
attribute.comment: field shall identify the pulse width emissions in units of seconds, Section 7.3.4

attribute.name: flags
attribute.comment: 16bit Boolean field shall contain various flags to indicate status information needed to process a DE, Section 7.3.4

attribute.name: pulseShape
attribute.comment: Field shall identify the pulse shape and shall be represented as an 8-bit enumeration, Section 7.3.4

attribute.name: padding1
attribute.comment: padding, Section 7.3.4

attribute.name: padding2
attribute.comment: padding, Section 7.3.4

attribute.name: padding3
attribute.comment: padding, Section 7.3.4

attribute.name: numberOfDERecords
attribute.comment: Field shall specify the number of DE records, Section 7.3.4

attribute.name: dERecords
attribute.comment: Fields shall contain one or more DE records, records shall conform to the variable record format (Section6.2.82), Section 7.3.4

class.name: EntityDamageStatusPdu
class.comment: shall be used to communicate detailed damage information sustained by an entity regardless of the source of the damage Section 7.3.5 COMPLETE

attribute.name: damagedEntityID
attribute.comment: Field shall identify the damaged entity (see 6.2.28), Section 7.3.4 COMPLETE

attribute.name: numberOfDamageDescription
attribute.comment: field shall specify the number of Damage Description records, Section 7.3.5

attribute.name: damageDescriptionRecords
attribute.comment: Fields shall contain one or more Damage Description records (see 6.2.17) and may contain other Standard Variable records, Section 7.3.5

class.name: LogisticsFamilyPdu
class.comment: Abstract superclass for logistics PDUs. Section 7.4 COMPLETE

class.name: ServiceRequestPdu
class.comment: Service Request PDU shall be used to communicate information associated with one entity requesting a service from another). Section 7.4.2 COMPLETE

attribute.name: requestingEntityID
attribute.comment: Entity that is requesting service (see 6.2.28), Section 7.4.2

attribute.name: servicingEntityID
attribute.comment: Entity that is providing the service (see 6.2.28), Section 7.4.2

attribute.name: serviceTypeRequested
attribute.comment: Type of service requested, Section 7.4.2

attribute.name: numberOfSupplyTypes
attribute.comment: How many requested, Section 7.4.2

list.comment: Field shall specify the type of supply and the amount of that supply for the number specified in the numberOfSupplyTypes (see 6.2.85), Section 7.4.2

class.name: ResupplyOfferPdu
class.comment: Information used to communicate the offer of supplies by a supplying entity to a receiving entity. Section 7.4.3 COMPLETE

attribute.name: receivingEntityID
attribute.comment: Field identifies the Entity and respective Entity Record ID that is receiving service (see 6.2.28), Section 7.4.3

attribute.name: supplyingEntityID
attribute.comment: Identifies the Entity and respective Entity ID Record that is supplying (see 6.2.28), Section 7.4.3

attribute.name: numberOfSupplyTypes
attribute.comment: How many supplies types are being offered, Section 7.4.3

attribute.name: supplies
attribute.comment: A Reord that Specifies the type of supply and the amount of that supply for each of the supply types in numberOfSupplyTypes (see 6.2.85), Section 7.4.3

class.name: ResupplyReceivedPdu
class.comment: Section 7.4.4. Receipt of supplies is communicated by issuing Resupply Received PDU. COMPLETE

attribute.name: receivingEntityID
attribute.comment: Entity that is receiving service. Shall be represented by Entity Identifier record (see 6.2.28)

attribute.name: supplyingEntityID
attribute.comment: Entity that is supplying. Shall be represented by Entity Identifier record (see 6.2.28)

attribute.name: numberOfSupplyTypes
attribute.comment: How many supplies are taken by receiving entity

attribute.name: supplies
attribute.comment: Type and amount of supplies for each specified supply type. See 6.2.85 for supply quantity record.

class.name: RepairCompletePdu
class.comment: Section 7.4.6. Service Request PDU is received and repair is complete. COMPLETE

attribute.name: receivingEntityID
attribute.comment: Entity that is receiving service. See 6.2.28

attribute.name: repairingEntityID
attribute.comment: Entity that is supplying. See 6.2.28

attribute.name: repair

class.name: RepairResponsePdu

class.name: StartResumePdu
class.comment: Section 7.5.4. Start or resume an exercise. COMPLETE

attribute.name: originatingID
attribute.comment: Identifier for originating entity(or simulation)

attribute.name: receivingID
attribute.comment: Identifier for the receiving entity(or simulation)

attribute.name: realWorldTime
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the real-world time (UTC) at which the entity is to start/resume in the exercise. This information shall be used by the participating simulation applications to start/resume an exercise synchronously. This field shall be represented by a Clock Time record (see 6.2.16).

attribute.name: simulationTime
attribute.comment: The reference time within a simulation exercise. This time is established ahead of time by simulation management and is common to all participants in a particular exercise. Simulation time may be either Absolute Time or Relative Time. This field shall be represented by a Clock Time record (see 6.2.16)

attribute.name: requestID
attribute.comment: Identifier for the specific and unique start/resume request

attribute.name: reason

attribute.name: frozenBehavior

attribute.name: requestID

class.comment: Section 5.3.7.1. Information about active electronic warfare (EW) emissions and active EW countermeasures shall be communicated using an Electromagnetic Emission PDU. NOT COMPLETE

attribute.name: emittingEntityID
attribute.comment: ID of the entity emitting

attribute.name: eventID
attribute.comment: ID of event

attribute.name: stateUpdateIndicator
attribute.comment: This field shall be used to indicate if the data in the PDU represents a state update or just data that has changed since issuance of the last Electromagnetic Emission PDU [relative to the identified entity and emission system(s)].

attribute.name: numberOfSystems
attribute.comment: This field shall specify the number of emission systems being described in the current PDU.

attribute.name: systemDataLength
attribute.comment: this field shall specify the length of this emitter system's data in 32-bit words.

attribute.name: numberOfBeams
attribute.comment: the number of beams being described in the current PDU for the emitter system being described.

attribute.name: emitterSystem
attribute.comment: information about a particular emitter system and shall be represented by an Emitter System record (see 6.2.23).

attribute.name: location
attribute.comment: the location of the antenna beam source with respect to the emitting entity's coordinate system. This location shall be the origin of the emitter coordinate system that shall have the same orientation as the entity coordinate system. This field shall be represented by an Entity Coordinate Vector record see 6.2.95
